definition: to come and go/to roam about (mostly unseen)/(of a ghost) to haunt (a place)/(of a criminal) to stalk (the streets)/(of the sun) to rise and set

to go out/to come out/to occur/to produce/to go beyond/to rise/to put forth/to happen/(used after a verb to indicate an outward direction or a positive result)/classifier for dramas, plays, operas etc
variant of 出[chu1] (classifier for plays or chapters of classical novels)
(negative prefix for verbs)/have not/not
drowned/to end/to die/to inundate
to appear and disappear unpredictably

sentences.english: Dall's sheep and mountain goats are found in the park's alpine environment.
sentences.chinese: 公园的山区还有大角羊和山羊出没。

sentences.english: The mammoth buffalo roamed the plains.
sentences.chinese: 庞大的野牛群出没在这些平原上。

sentences.english: A gnome that haunts underground places in German folklore.
sentences.chinese: 地灵德国民间传说中在地下出没的地神。

sentences.english: For mount Sion, because it is destroyed, foxes have walked upon it.
sentences.chinese: 因为熙雍山已经荒芜，狐狸成群出没其间。

sentences.english: That pub is the haunt of all the lay– abouts in the district.
sentences.chinese: 寻家酒店是这个区所有的闲荡的人出没的地方。

sentences.english: It haunts the depths of the earth and the sea. It gleams from the hues of the shell and the precious stone.
sentences.chinese: 美，出没于深海幽谷，在奇石贝壳的色彩中闪烁。

sentences.english: Any of the following situations can occur when in bear country.
sentences.chinese: 在有熊出没的乡村，以下任何情况都有可能发生。

sentences.english: The same is true for the bandit infested village quests .
sentences.chinese: 这同样适用于村的土匪出没的追求。

sentences.english: The local government closed the lido announcing that some sharks were emerging there.
sentences.chinese: 地方政府关闭了海滨浴场，宣称海里有鲨鱼出没。

sentences.english: People say ghosts haunt that old house .
sentences.chinese: 人们说鬼常出没于那幢古老的房子。

sentences.english: Myrtle haunts a girls' bathroom on the second floor.
sentences.chinese: 桃金娘经常出没在二楼的一间女盥洗室。

sentences.english: Men needed to predict where and when animals would be available for hunting.
sentences.chinese: 男人需要预测动物出没的时间与地点以便狩猎。

sentences.english: The area was forbidden for people to enter as there are a lot of wild dragons, " Harum said."
sentences.chinese: 但是该地区由于许多野龙出没并不允许人们私自闯入。

sentences.english: Crocodile-infested water, and strive to surpass themselves.
sentences.chinese: 鳄鱼出没的水，努力超越自己。

sentences.english: “Iron-clad” warships prowled up and down the coast, maintaining a Union blockade of Confederate ports.
sentences.chinese: 铁壳战船出没于海湾，封锁了南军港口。

sentences.english: Until today, the police are still receiving reports about the emergence of Mothman.
sentences.chinese: 直至今日警察依然会接到关于蛾人出没的消息。

definition: to wander/to roam about/to loaf about/to be idle
making up a group, forming a troupe (idiom); in large numbers/as a large crowd
in groups/large numbers of/grouping
nocturnal/to hide by day and come out at night
lit. to appear and disappear unpredictably like a spirit or a ghost (idiom)/fig. elusive
lit. men's footprints are rare (idiom)/fig. off the beaten track/lonely/deserted
no sign of human habitation (idiom); desolate
to hide/to go into hiding/to take refuge
tracks/trail/footprint/trace/vestige
to forage/to hunt for food/to scavenge/fig. to make a living
jungle/thicket/forest/Buddhist monastery
sign of human habitation
to be on one's own/to be left alone/to be left out
to conceal oneself/to go into hiding/to take cover
desolate and uninhabited (idiom)
to occupy illegally/to seize (territory)/to entrench (oneself)
